pullRequest.title: Add Retire.js Addon
pullRequest.bodyText:
New add-on with passive scanner based on RetireJS/retire.js.
Basic UnitTest.
Basic help entry.
Icon taken from https://github.com/RetireJS profile image (globe with shield). Included at "normal" 128x128 and resized 16x16.
GitHub Action to create update PRs once a month. (Pattern updates only seem to occur once or twice a month in recent history https://github.com/RetireJS/retire.js/commits/master/repository . A manual update can always be done if necessary.)
TestUtils required some changes to address being an addon with no extension.

[Use gson to parse the Retire.js JSON input collection. Rework code to use gson so there's no need to worry about unchecked conversions. Model partially generated leveraging jsonschema2pojo.org]
Signed-off-by: kingthorin kingthorin@users.noreply.github.com

beforeCommit.message:
Use gson to parse the Retire.js JSON input collection

conversions.

nodes.bodyText: I tried adding a UnitTest for this leveraging this.nano.addHandler and reading a file like we do with ascanrules but kept running into an NPE. I then tried adding it as an inline string but it's >65KB and wouldn't let me.

@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@ + + + + +Retire.js + + + +

Retire.js

+ +This add-on includes a passive scan rule which implements checks provided by Retire.js +in order to identify vulnerable or out-dated JavaScript packages. +
